text: senior greek bankers are telling me that
even with the restrictions in place on
withdrawals and transfers they are
likely to run out of cash within days
how are you going to support the Greek
banking system well we all expect that
this be this morning we'll take the
obvious decision to provide some extra
ela to the Greek banking system
definitely for seven or ten days that
the negotiations will go on so the Greek
banking system will be secure and the
negotiations that have to take place
will go on smoothly and if the European
Central Bank was simply to freeze the
amount of emergency landing available
what would you have to do then well we
have to look at the numbers again but
they think that the liquidity is secure
for a number of days and together with a
recycling process that is going on
probably this may be extended but the
secure solution the secure solution is
always the decision officially and I
think this is the only proper thing to
do today but even if they freeze it you
think you could allow people to continue
to take out the 60 euros a day well we
think that the estimate their data from
last week indicate that there is cash
availability for a number of days of
this week as well a few days but
nonetheless the European Central Bank
really is under pressure to provide a
bit more capacity obviously yes but to
be absolutely clear this government
wants to stay in the euro that's
definite that has been the slogan before
the referendum we want to stay in the
euro we want a better deal a more
balanced deal and that is a promise we
gave to the no vaulters and this is what
we are planning to do
